info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 7:21PM EDT until July 28 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR EASTERN WARREN AND NORTHWESTERN HALIFAX COUNTIES... At 721 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Littleton, or 8 miles east of Warrenton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Littleton, Macon, Arcola, Medoc Mountain State Park, Airlie, Lake Gaston, Southpointe And Morningstar Marinas and Roanoke Rapids Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
